pre.rewrite_response: Stay calm and immediately call emergency services. If the child is coughing forcefully, encourage them to keep coughing. If they cannot breathe, speak, or cough effectively, perform age-appropriate choking procedures: for a child over one year, perform abdominal thrusts (the Heimlich maneuver); for infants under one year, use a combination of back blows and chest thrusts. Monitor the child and be prepared to start CPR if they become unresponsive.
